instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2784: What is 820-2784? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.P5V_S3: What is P5V_S3? This is a typo of PP5V_S3 When you see P5V_S3, assume they meant to type PP5V_S3.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: iMac A1311 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't turn on
threads.message:
Hi everyone , here an  iMac don't power on only one led on , no chime , no spin, no light on mouse 

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>   3.43
<SIGNAL>PP12V_G3H</SIGNAL>.    12.09


<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.       3.31
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>          4.99
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S5</SIGNAL>        12

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL>         1.5
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>         3.3
<SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>              5.10

<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0</SIGNAL>                            12.8
<SIGNAL>PP0V75_S0</SIGNAL>                           0.75
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SM_PCH_LAN</SIGNAL>       0
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>                           1.06
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>                                5
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>                             3.31
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL>                             1.8
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>                             1.48
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_CPU_MEM</SIGNAL>               1.49
<SIGNAL>PPVTT_S0</SIGNAL>                            1.11
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>              1.12
<SIGNAL>PPVTT_S0_DDR</SIGNAL>                    0.75

any idea ?  

thanks , Any help would be appreciated!

threads.title: iMac A1311 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't turn on
threads.message:
I suppose you get light on LED601.
But LED605 MUST too, as you have <SIGNAL>3V3_S3</SIGNAL>.
Please recheck...

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> should also be present, with mentioned voltages.
So LED602 must be on too.

threads.title: iMac A1311 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2784</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't turn on
threads.message: Graphics card can prevent POST. Check if it chimes without graphics card, try another (known good) one if possible.
